moves.1. e4: Hi everyone - here is the second of a double bill for you - yet again Glenda will have the final say.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 Nf6: 3. .......... Nf6 - fairly standard Hanham Phildor moves.
moves.4. Nc3 Qe7 5. dxe5 dxe5 6. Bc4 g6: 6.  ............. g6 - preparing Bg7 but black does not complete the fianchetto.  I continue developing at a very rapid pace.  Here my development is about to stall until my last move of the game because black's game is about to explode!  Wait for it .......
moves.8. Nd5: 8. Nd5!! - NOW!!!  This move wins at least a piece, in fact it is about to net much, much more.
moves.8... Qd7: 8. ............ Qd7?? - Allows a devastating knight fork but black is already up the creek.
moves.9. Nxf6+ Ke7 10. Nxd7+ Ke8 11. Nf6+ Ke7: 12. ............ Kd7.  This does allow a nasty double check netting the black rook on a8, but here comes something better, something much much better!
moves.13. Nxe5+:
13. Nxe5 !! - This stunning sacrifice forces mate in I think all variations.   These variations are as follows. 

Variation A
13. Nxe5  Ke8 
14. Nf6  Ke7 
15. Nxc6  bxc6 
16. Ng4  f6 
17. Bxf6  Ke8 
18. Qd8# 

Variation B
12. Nd5  Kd7 
13. Nxe5  Nxe5 
14. Nb6  Kc6 
15. Qd5  Kxb6 
16. Qb5# 

Variation C
13. Nxe5  Ke6 
14. Nxc7  Kxe5 
15. Qd5# 

Variation D
13. Nxe5  Kd6 
14. Nc3  Kxe5 
15. Qd5# 

Variation E
13. Nxe5  Kd6 
14. Nc3  Kc5 
15. Qd5  Kb4 
16. a3# 

I now set up some conditional moves.
moves.13... Nxe5 14. Nb6+ Ke8: 14. ............ Ke8 - white shortens Variation B and now I deliver mate on d8.  This is just surreal.

gameName: Barmy Army Mini Tournament - Glenda Strikes Again!
